resources.description: Citation Information:nOriginator:nGeothermal Development Associates, Reno NevadanOriginator:nUnited States Geological Survey (USGS)nOriginator: Colorado Geological SurveynPublication Date:n2012nTitle:nFavorable GeochemistrynEdition:nFirstnPublication Information:nPublication Place:nReno NevadanPublisher:nGeothermal Development Associates, Reno, NevadanDescription:nThis layer contains favorable geochemistry as interpreted by Rick Zehner. The data is compiled from the data obtained from the USGS. The original data set combines 15,622 samples collected in the State of Colorado from several sources including 1) the original Geotherm geochemical database, 2) USGS NWIS (National Water Information System), 3) Colorado Geological Survey geothermal sample data, and 4) original samples collected by R. Zehner at various sites during the 2011 field season. These samples are also available in a separate shapefile FlintWaterSamples.shp. Data from all samples were reportedly collected using standard water sampling protocols (filtering through 0.45 micron filter, etc.) Sample information was standardized to ppm (micrograms/liter) in spreadsheet columnsnSpatial Domain:nExtent:nTop:n4515595.841032 mnLeft:n149699.513964 mnRight:n757959.309388 mnBottom:n4104156.435530 mnContact Information:nContact Organization:nGeothermal Development Associates, Reno, NevadanContact Person:nRichard u201cRicku201d ZehnernAddress:n3740 Barron WaynCity:nRenonState:nNVnPostal Code:n89511nCountry:nUSAnContact Telephone:n775-737-7806nSpatial Reference Information:nCoordinate System:nUniversal Transverse Mercator (UTM) WGSu20191984 Zone 13NnFalse Easting:n500000.00000000nFalse Northing:n0.00000000nCentral Meridian:n-105.00000000nScale Factor:n0.99960000nLatitude of Origin:n0.00000000nLinear Unit:nMeternDatum:nWorld Geodetic System 1984 (WGS u20191984)nPrime Meridian:nGreenwichnAngular Unit:nDegreenDigital Form:nFormat Name:nShape file
resources.name: favorable geothermal geochemistry from spring and wells in colorado.zip

title: Favorable Geochemistry from Springs and Wells in COlorado
name: favorable-geochemistry-from-springs-and-wells-in-colorado
notes: Citation Information:nOriginator:nGeothermal Development Associates, Reno NevadanOriginator:nUnited States Geological Survey (USGS)nOriginator:nColorado Geological SurveynPublication Date:n2012nTitle:nFavorable GeochemistrynEdition:nFirstnPublication Information:nPublication Place:nReno NevadanPublisher:nGeothermal Development Associates, Reno, NevadanDescription:nThis layer contains favorable geochemistry for high-temperature geothermal systems, as interpreted by Richard

Zehner. The data is compiled from the data obtained from the USGS. The original data set combines 15,622 samples collected in the State of Colorado from several sources including 1) the original Geotherm geochemical database, 2) USGS NWIS (National Water Information System), 3) Colorado Geological Survey geothermal sample data, and 4) original samples collected by R. Zehner at various sites during the 2011 field season. These samples are also available in a separate shapefile FlintWaterSamples.shp. Data from all samples were reportedly collected using standard water sampling protocols (filtering through 0.45 micron filter, etc.) Sample information was standardized to ppm (micrograms/liter) in spreadsheet columns. Commonly-used cation and silica geothermometer temperature estimates are included.nSpatial Domain:nExtent:nTop:n4515595.841032 mnLeft:n149699.513964 mnRight:n757959.309388 mnBottom:n4104156.435530 mnContact Information:nContact Organization:nGeothermal Development Associates, Reno, NevadanContact Person:nRichard u201cRicku201d ZehnernAddress:n3740 Barron WaynCity:nRenonState:nNVnPostal Code:n89511nCountry:nUSAnContact Telephone:n775-737-7806nSpatial Reference Information:nCoordinate System:nUniversal Transverse Mercator (UTM) WGSu20191984 Zone 13NnFalse Easting:n500000.00000000nFalse Northing:n0.00000000nCentral Meridian:n-105.00000000nScale Factor:n0.99960000nLatitude of Origin:n0.00000000nLinear Unit:nMeternDatum:nWorld Geodetic System 1984 (WGS u20191984)nPrime Meridian:nGreenwichnAngular Unit:nDegreenDigital Form:nFormat Name:nShape file
